channel.title: NiceTux by Matthew Hungerford
channel.description: Recent content on NiceTux by Matthew Hungerford

item.title: Qtstickercam
item.description: My son got a webcam for his PC, and wanted to do stickers on pictures, similar to those on Android and IPhone mobile apps.

item.title: Cosmo's Star
item.description: Qt-based game for Android/Web/Linux written as part of the itch.

item.title: Updating Projects
item.description: Many of the sections in the section header are incomplete, I am still catching up on finding pictures and links to old games and projects.

item.title: First Post
item.description: Created this site to archive past games I have written or ported, as well as interesting applications or projects I have worked on.

item.title: Opposite Lock - GP2x Port
item.description: GP2x Port of J2ME Game: Opposite Lock (GPL’d 3d racing game originally coded by Carl Woffenden) OpenHandhelds.

item.title: King Of Fighters - Pandora Port
item.description: Pandora Port of Bennu Engine Game: King of Fighters (Fan remake originally coded by Carl Francisco Javier del Pino Cuesta)

item.title: Mister Hachi (SHMUP) - GP2x Port
item.description: GP2x Port of J2ME Game: Mister Hachi (SHMUP) (Freeware game originally coded by Carl Francisco Javier del Pino Cuesta)

item.title: ChargePoint Tensorflow-Powered TouchScreens
item.description: ChargePoint EV Chargers have to support extreme conditions, from being covered in ice after a winter storm in Finland, to extreme heat and sun in desert like environments like LA.

item.title: Unicorn Paint
item.description: For my daughters upcoming birthday I wrote a fun little finger-painting game.

item.title: Qt-WebAssembly ChargePoint EV Charger Simulator
item.description: During a Qt Live Event in Palo Alto, saw an awesome demonstration of Qt’s upcoming WebAssembly support.

item.title: Pandas and bananas
item.description: Simple but fun game “Pandas and Bananas” I created for the Pebble Smartwatch.

item.title: Pebble Emulator demo for Qemu Advent Calendar
item.description: Pebble was developing a emulator of our smartwatch for the desktop to improve the developer experience, but we were months away from deploying it to our SDK.

item.title: XKCD Comics Viewer
item.description: After porting PNG support to Pebble, found a use for the 10x increase in image storage in the creation of a XKCD Comic viewer.

item.title: PebbleGL OpenGL Implementation
item.description: During a Pebble Hackathon at the office, myself and Justin McGirr endeavored to create an OpenGL implementation for the Pebble Smartwatch.

item.title: Pebble SmartWatch UI Sketchup Tool
item.description: While I was working at Pebble, I found myself mocking up my applications and partner applications as a series of screenshot and looking at them on the watch.

item.title: Skype for PS Vita
item.description: Had a blast while working at Skype.

item.title: Nexis/787 UI
item.description: While working at Astronautics, I created the widget toolkit and built the UI for the NEXIS flight system, as well as the previous 787 flight system.
I’ve built Linux-based products at companies including Skype, Microsoft and now ChargePoint.
